metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2143 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The fork implementation in the Linux kernel before 4.5 on s390 platforms mishandles the case of four page-table levels, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted application, related to arch/s390/include/asm/mmu_context.h and arch/s390/include/asm/pgalloc.h. Marcin Kościelnicki discovered that the Linux kernel's fork implementation incorrectly handled the case of four page-table levels on s390 platforms. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> s390x only

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.5').
linux-signed package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
